text:
p(x|µ) = µx(1 −µ)1−x, x ∈{0,1}. (6.112)
This can be written in exponential family form
p(x|µ) = exp
[
log
(
µx(1 −µ)1−x)]
(6.113a)
= exp [xlog µ+ (1 −x) log(1−µ)] (6.113b)
= exp [xlog µ−xlog(1 −µ) + log(1−µ)] (6.113c)
= exp
[
xlog µ
1−µ + log(1 −µ)
]
. (6.113d)
The last line (6.113d) can be identiﬁed as being in exponential family
form (6.107) by observing that
h(x) = 1 (6.114)
Draft (2019-10-15) of “Mathematics for Machine Learning”. Feedback:https://mml-book.com.
